problem.markdown:
>>Consider a six-sided die. A is the event of getting an even number (2, 4, 6) and B is the event of getting a number more than or equal to 4 (4, 5, 6). What is the probability of P(A∩B)?<<
( ) 0 (x) 1/3 ( ) 1 ( ) 2/3
[Explanation] The probability of P(A∩B) is the intersection of A and B. In this case that would be the numbers 4 and 6. Since 4 and 6 represent two numbers out of the set of 6 (six sided die), we have: 2/6 = 1/3.
